tweets.text:
A planning application has been submitted for the first phase of the #Preston & South Ribble #Flood Risk Management Scheme.

We've worked alongside partners to develop plans for a ¬£49 million scheme that will reduce flood risk to 4,800 homes & businesses: https://t.co/g1aXy0cRtn https://t.co/sss0ID2jqv

Did you know that many of our regions rivers have cameras installed on them?  

Cameras allow us to remotely monitor the river levels as well as check on the build up of debris and rubbish. 

A shiny new camera has today been installed at Heversham in South #Cumbria. https://t.co/QhvxLVVcqu

urls.title: Thames Water discharging raw sewage into Buckinghamshire river
urls.description: River Chess Association say untreated sewage is causing untold harm to infant trout and other habitats

tweets.text:
Another week and yet another example of what a failed and discredited organisation the @EnvAgency has become.

https://t.co/4DP5nBsia5

@YuengP @EnvAgency It was odd how the flood water rose in 2 phases: 1st slow; 2nd rapid. Looking at the data from neighbouring gauges it appears to be a clever effect of the weir reducing the flood impact up to a limit. #probablyStuffHydrologistsKnow @NatResWales @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/bhAdSEEBhu

üåøüìó'@IPBES #GlobalAssessment concluded that #nature is deteriorating at a rate and scale unprecedented in human history

As far as the eye could see, the River Thames had inundated this floodplain in Oxfordshire today. This is why development of floodplains is not advisable. The water will just flood the next place, or places, downstream ‚Äî which could well be a town or village. https://t.co/0K2Qjv5g6G

Parkgate Rd took a real hit last week & it will be some time before some of my neighbours can return to their flooded homes. Huge shout out to @Go_CheshireWest, @CheshireFire @cheshirepolice etc for all their support. We just need @EnvAgencyNW to sort out the Highfield Drain now. https://t.co/V54fOFFEaz https://t.co/X2Zr9eyATR

Councillors in Cambridgeshire are calling on the @EnvAgency to explain why legal action has not been taken against those responsible for illegally dumping 122,000 tonnes of waste in the Fens.
https://t.co/oYjI8zSYBs

Accompanied by the usual BS statements from the @EnvAgency "We do allow storm overflows to discharge exceptionally into chalk streams".

Last time I checked, which was last week, TW had been dumping sewage into the River Chess for the 6th day in a row. Exceptional? https://t.co/N2khh8uHfr
